page.title: 20The Newcastle Metro
page.content: An underground system was begun in the '70s to connect bus stations and to key city points. It continues as the old district BR system at the edge of the centre. Two{tunnels}were made. The N-S tunnel goes underground at {Jesmond}to{Haymarket}(Univ, Poly, Hosp.) under the shopping complex to { {Monument}(shops, theatres) and beyond the CBD to the BR station and a new river bridge (S of our area). The W-E line starts at{St James} (Soccer ground and coach Sta.) crosses at{Monument}(2 level interchange) and runs on a long new surface viaduct to Byker. Bright, fast, stay-clean and easy to use it is popular and liked. Most important points are near a station and it is easy to plan town trips. It has a good reliability record and fares are low although costs are high.
